My opinions are always improving.

I am an occupational therapist and work in a Community Mental Health Team in Cornwall. I live with Martyn and our spaniel cross Reggie. I have lived in Cheshire, Derbyshire, Suffolk, Merseyside, North Yorkshire, and currently the Tamar Valley. In my spare time, I enjoy reading, watching films and TV, walking, nature, the countryside, jigsaws, colouring, and embroidery. My main hobby is taking photos of Devon, Cornwall, and sometimes further a field. I'm also practising my street photography.

I'm Matthew Christopher, creator of the Abandoned America website, podcast, and book series about the beautiful and fascinating ruins in our midst. Photos are mine unless credited otherwise. Not a photo bot, so I post about other things from time to time.

Project Gutenberg, founded in 1971, is the oldest producer and distributor of free ebooks.

According to Michael Hart (March 8, 1947 – September 6, 2011), founder of Project Gutenberg, the mission of Project Gutenberg is simple: to encourage the creation and distribution of eBooks.
This mission is, as much as possible, to encourage all those who are interested in making eBooks and helping to give them away.
